name: Notation
description: Azure Pipepine Task for setting up Notation CLI, sign and verify with Notation
author: Notation Developers

inputs.name: isCustomVersion
inputs.label: Custom Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, you can provide a custom version for the task

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of Notation to install. Example: 1.0.0, 1, 1.0, 1.0.0

inputs.name: checksum
inputs.label: Checksum
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SHA-256 checksum of the downloaded file

inputs.name: artifactRefs
inputs.label: Artifact references
inputs.helpMarkDown: Container artifact references for signing. If it was not specified, use the artifact reference from previous Docker push task. Example: <registry name>/<repository name>@<digest> If multiple, separate by comma.

inputs.name: allowReferrersAPI
inputs.label: [Experimental] Allow Referrers API
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the Referrers API to sign signatures, if not supported (returns 404), fallback to the Referrers tag schema.

inputs.name: akvPluginVersion
inputs.label: Plugin Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of the Azure Key Vault plugin to be installed. please visit the [release page](https://github.com/Azure/notation-azure-kv/releases) for the available versions.

inputs.name: azurekvServiceConection
inputs.label: Azure Key Vault service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure subscription for the key vault if prefer to use service connection for authentication.

inputs.name: keyid
inputs.label: Key ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Key ID is the key or certificate identifier for Azure Key Vault.

inputs.name: caCertBundle
inputs.label: Certificate Bundle File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: A file with root and all intermediate certificates, starting from the root certificate, following the order in the certificate chain.

inputs.name: trustPolicy
inputs.label: Trust Policy File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the [trust policy](https://github.com/notaryproject/specifications/blob/v1.0.0/specs/trust-store-trust-policy.md#trust-policy) file relative to the repository. Example: ./path/to/trust-policy.json

inputs.name: trustStore
inputs.label: Trust Store Folder Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the directory containing the [trust store](https://github.com/notaryproject/specifications/blob/v1.0.0/specs/trust-store-trust-policy.md#trust-store) relative to the repository. Example: ./path/to/truststore/

messages.AzureKVPluginAlreadyInstalled: Azure Key Vault plugin v%s is already installed.
messages.FailedToAddCertToTrustStore: Failed to add a certificate to trust store: %s.
messages.FailedToGetWorkloadIdToken: Failed to get workload identity token: %s.
messages.FailedToListTrustStore: Failed to list the trust store.
messages.TryToGetArtifactRefsFromDockerTask: Try to get artifact references from Docker task.
messages.TempDirectoryOrWorkingDirectoryNotSet: Agent.TempDirectory or system.DefaultWorkingDirectory is not set
messages.NotationAlreadyInstalled: Notation is already installed, please do not install it again.
messages.NoServiceConnection: No Azure Key Vault service connection endpoint is specified.
messages.UseManagedIdentity: Use managed identity to access Azure Key Vault.
